Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek Papyrus
Description: This fragment of papyrus which dates from the second half of the second century of our era contains several verses (265-292) of the 12th book of the Iliad. This part of the epic of Homer deals with the battle of the Greeks and the Trojans around the walls of the town of Troy. The verso of the papyrus carries an onomastic which suggests an oxyrhynchite origin of the document.
